meanings.definition: The state or quality of being partially dark.
meanings.sent1: In the semidarknesses of the room, I could barely see the outline of the furniture.
meanings.sent2: The semidarknesses of the forest made it difficult to navigate without a flashlight.
meanings.sent3: As the power outage continued, we resorted to telling spooky stories in the semidarknesses.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a maze of semidarknesses, with memories flickering like distant stars.
meanings.sent5: The semidarknesses enveloped the old attic, hiding its secrets in the shadows.

meanings.definition: The dim light or shadowy area between light and darkness.
meanings.sent1: The semidarknesses under the trees provided a cool retreat from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent2: She loved to sit in the semidarknesses of the library, surrounded by books.
meanings.sent3: The cat played hide-and-seek in the semidarknesses of the basement, pouncing on imaginary prey.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts wandered in the semidarknesses of uncertainty, searching for a glimmer of clarity.
meanings.sent5: The semidarknesses of twilight painted the sky in hues of purple and gold.
